verses.text: 稱頌 神公義的審判 （大衛的詩，交給詩班長，調用“慕拉賓」。）耶和華啊！我要全心稱謝你，我要述說你一切奇妙的作為。

words.note: Refers to the one true God.
A transliterated Hebrew title or musical instruction in Psalms.

verses.text: 我要因你快樂歡欣；至高者啊！我要歌頌你的名。

words.note: Refers to God as the highest being.

verses.text: 我的仇敵轉身退後的時候，就在你的面前絆倒、滅亡。
因為你為我伸了冤，辨了屈；你坐在寶座上，施行公義的審判。
你斥責了列國，滅絕了惡人；你塗抹了他們的名，直到永永遠遠。

words.note: A reduplicated idiom emphasizing eternity.

verses.text: 仇敵的結局到了，他們遭毀滅，直到永遠；你拆毀他們的城鎮，使它們湮沒無聞。

words.note: A four-character idiom (成語) meaning to be completely forgotten.

verses.text: 耶和華卻永遠坐著為王，為了施行審判，他已經設立寶座。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
A common phrase in biblical context for God's sovereignty.

words.definition: in order to, for the sake of

words.note: Commonly used in royal and religious contexts.

verses.text: 他必以公義審判世界，按正直判斷萬民。

words.note: Expresses certainty or inevitability, especially in biblical contexts.
A fundamental concept in Christian theology.
Often used in scripture to refer to all humanity.

verses.text: 耶和華要給受欺壓的人作保障，作患難時的避難所。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Describes those who suffer injustice.
Used to describe God as a protector.
A common biblical term for suffering or trouble.
A specific place of safety during danger.

verses.text: 認識你名的人必倚靠你；耶和華啊！你從未撇棄尋求你的人。

words.note: In biblical contexts, 'name' often signifies character, authority, or presence.
Expresses certainty or inevitability.
Emphasizes faith and dependence on God.
The Hebrew name for God.
Used to express emotion, similar to 'O' in English.
A strong negative adverb meaning 'never before'.
Often used in scripture regarding God's faithfulness.
Implies an active and intentional pursuit.

verses.text: 你們要歌頌住在錫安的耶和華，要在萬民中傳揚他的作為。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Refers to all peoples, often non-Israelite nations in biblical context.

verses.text: 因為那追討流人血的罪的，他記念受苦的人，他沒有忘記他們的哀求。

words.note: Turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, 'the one who...'

verses.text: 耶和華啊！求你恩待我，看看那些恨我的人加給我的苦難；求你把我從死門拉上來，

words.note: Reduplication of verb indicates a brief or casual action.
Indicates direct object is affected by the verb.

words.definition: gates of death, realm of death
words.note: A metaphorical term for the verge of death or the underworld.

verses.text: 好叫我述說你一切可稱頌的事，並在錫安的城門（「的城門」原文作「女子的門」）因你的救恩歡樂。

words.note: Archaic term, often refers to young women or daughters.

verses.text: 列國陷入自己挖掘的坑中，他們的腳在自己暗設的網裡纏住了。

words.note: Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 耶和華已經把自己顯明，又施行了審判；惡人被自己手所作的纏住了。（希迦庸、細拉）

words.note: Marks the direct object, often indicating disposal or action upon something.
Forms a nominal phrase from a verb or verb phrase.
A Hebrew term, likely indicating a musical interlude or solemn meditation.
A Hebrew term, likely indicating a pause for reflection or musical interlude.

verses.text: 惡人都必歸到陰間，忘記 神的列國都必滅亡。

words.note: The preceding space is a traditional mark of reverence in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 但貧窮的人必不會被永遠遺忘，困苦人的希望也必不會永久落空。
耶和華啊！求你起來，不要讓世人得勝；願列國都在你面前受審判。

words.note: Expresses exclamation or affirmation.

verses.text: 耶和華啊！求你使他們驚懼，願列國都知道自己不過是人。（細拉）

words.note: Expresses exclamation or affirmation.
A Hebrew term, likely indicating a pause for reflection or musical interlude.
